data.title: Bitcoin not the ‘end goal’ says Riot as BTC production jumps 27%
data.description:
Riot sees Bitcoin mining as a “means to an end,” planning to pivot its power resources to build a 1-gigawatt AI data center campus.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/riot-platform-bitcoin-not-end-goal-mining-production-q3?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: After being liquidated, Brother Machi continued to increase his long positions in ETH, resulting in a total loss of $14.5 million.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, after being liquidated, Machi continued to increase his ETH long position with 25x leverage, and his losses in contract and spot trading have now reached $14.5 million.

data.title: WisdomTree launches 14 tokenized funds on the Plume blockchain.
data.description: Asset management firm WisdomTree has launched 14 tokenized funds on the Plume blockchain, broadening institutional investors' access to regulated on-chain investment products. These funds, available to users through the WisdomTree Connect platform, include the company's Government Money Market Digital Fund and CRDT Private Credit and Alternative Income Fund. Investors can hold, transfer, and settle positions directly on Plume's blockchain network. As part of this initiative, Galaxy Digital announced a $10 million investment in WisdomTree's Government Money Market Digital Fund, highlighting early institutional investor participation. Plume reportedly integrates KYC and AML compliance directly into the protocol layer, providing built-in security measures such as wallet screening and sanctions enforcement. (CoinDesk)

data.title: Star responded to the dismissal of the employee: "Builder 00X" had been in office for less than two months, and not a single major project had been completed.
data.description: In response to a post by a community user saying, "Firing Felix is ​​too undignified; one should live a dignified life," OKX founder and CEO Star responded on the X platform, saying, "Dignity is always mutual. X Layer is an early-stage public chain with a TVL of less than $100 million. Its strategic upgrade has only been going on for a little over three months, and builder 00X has only been in office for less than two months. None of the key projects have been completed yet. It's not worth having a large army of people here just to watch the drama unfold. The drama isn't ripe yet, and it's a waste of the X accounts we've nurtured."

data.title: Coinbase CEO's bizarre final words on Q3 call just paid off a lucky few
data.description:
Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong rattled off a bunch of crypto buzzwords at the end of its Q3 earnings call — resolving all prediction market bets on them to a “yes” in one swoop.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/coinbase-ceo-stirs-predictions-markets-in-earnings-call?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee Prepares Bipartisan Draft on Crypto Market Structure
data.description: According to PANews, multiple sources have revealed that the U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee is set to release a bipartisan draft concerning the commodity aspects of the cryptocurrency market structure bill. However, the exact timing of the release remains uncertain, with some sources suggesting it could happen as early as tomorrow, while others indicate that final preparations might delay it until next week. Regardless of the timing, the forthcoming draft, along with the resumption of bipartisan staff negotiations by the Banking Committee, signals that progress on market structure issues is back on track following last week's industry roundtable discussions.

data.description:
dYdX will not be able to offer perpetual futures trading in the U. S. , but said it will look forward to future regulatory changes.
source: https://www.theblock.co/post/377073/dydx-enter-us?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss

data.title: Cryptocurrency stocks retreated across the board, with AI stocks leading the decline at nearly 9%, and ETH falling below $3,900.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, all sectors of the crypto market experienced a pullback, with general declines ranging from 2% to 9%. The AI ​​sector led the decline in the past 24 hours, falling 8.60%. Within the AI ​​sector, Virtuals Protocol (VIRTUAL) and Fartcoin (FARTCOIN) fell by 10.96% and 13.75% respectively, while ChainOpera AI (COAI) plummeted by 41.71%. Additionally, Ethereum (ETH) fell 2.15%, dropping below $3,900. Bitcoin (BTC) fell 0.98%, falling below $107,000 before recovering to above $100,000. In other sectors, the CeFi sector fell 2.87% in the last 24 hours, with WhiteBIT Token (WBT) showing relative resilience, rising 2.30%. The Layer 1 sector fell 3.74%, with Sui (SUI) falling 7.15%. The PayFi sector fell 3.78%, but eCash (XEC) rose 2.05%. The Meme sector fell 4.70%, with MemeCore (M) bucking the trend and rising 7.69%. The DeFi sector fell 5.16%, with AERO (Aerodrome Finance) climbing 6.99% intraday. The Layer 2 sector fell 7.46%, with Mantle (MNT) falling 10.25%. Crypto sector indices reflecting historical performance show that the ssiLayer2, ssiAI, and ssiNFT indices fell 7.75%, 7.23%, and 7.04%, respectively.

data.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Dogecoin, XRP Tumble As Crypto Liquidations Top $1 Billion: Top Analyst Says ETH Could Retrace Sharply Before Hitting $10,000
data.description:
Leading cryptocurrencies tumbled alongside stocks on Thursday, as the U. S. -China trade truce failed to cheer investors. 
source: https://www.benzinga.com/crypto/cryptocurrency/25/10/48549381/bitcoin-ethereum-dogecoin-xrp-tumble-as-crypto-liquidations-top-1-billion-top-analyst-says-eth-could-retrace-sharply-before-hitting-10000?utm_source=cryptopanic.com&utm_campaign=partner_feed&utm_medium=partner_feed&utm_content=site

data.title: Aave Q3 earned nearly $4 million in interest income through GHO loans, a record high.
data.description: On-chain analyst @JackMandin published an article on the X platform stating that Aave earned nearly $4 million in interest income from its GHO lending business in the third quarter, a record high. Since Aave is the issuer of GHO, it can collect the entire amount of this interest as protocol revenue. As the scale of GHO expands, it will become an increasingly important factor driving Aave's revenue growth.

data.title: The IOPn testnet Genesis Badge event has begun.
data.description: IOPn, a Layer 1 project based on digital identity, announced on the X platform that the testnet Genesis Badge event has been launched. Users can claim Genesis Badges and earn points by following the prompts.

data.title: SEGG Media, a publicly traded company, plans to launch a $300 million digital asset program, initially focusing on Bitcoin.
data.description: Nasdaq-listed SEGG Media plans to launch a $300 million digital asset initiative, allocating 80% of the funds to a multi-asset cryptocurrency reserve. Bitcoin will be the initial focus of this reserve, providing a stable foundation, while other assets such as ETH, SOL, and ZIG will also be included to enhance yields through validator operations. (Cryptobriefing)

data.title: Gate Contract Points system has completed ten airdrop events, with a single account accumulating over $438 in earnings.
data.description: On-chain data shows that since Gate officially launched its contract points system on October 14th at 16:00 (UTC+8), it has completed ten airdrop events in just over ten days, covering 10 popular cryptocurrencies. The total earnings per account reached $438, with the highest single-event airdrop yielding over $120. It is understood that Gate's contract points mechanism is the first of its kind in the industry, aiming to create a virtuous cycle between trading incentives and community feedback, bringing continuous benefits to active users.

data.title: Standard Chartered predicts RWAs could reach $2 trillion by 2028
data.description:
Standard Chartered forecasts $2 trillion in tokenized assets by 2028, up from $35 billion today.
source: https://www.cryptopolitan.com/standard-chartered-predicts-rwas/

data.title: The US Solana spot ETF saw a net inflow of $37.33 million today, marking the third consecutive day of net inflows.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, on October 30th (Eastern Time), the total net inflow into US Solana spot ETFs was $37.33 million. Specifically, the Bitwise Solana spot ETF (BSOL) saw a single-day net inflow of $36.55 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $153 million; the Grayscale Solana spot ETF (GSOL) saw a single-day net inflow of $780,000, bringing its historical total net inflow to $2.18 million. As of press time, the total net asset value of Solana spot ETFs was $440 million, with a net asset value ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of total market capitalization) of 0.44%, and a historical cumulative net inflow of $155 million.

data.title: The US-listed Hedera ETF saw a record net inflow of $29.9 million in a single day; the Litecoin ETF experienced no net inflows or outflows.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, on October 30th (Eastern Time), the Canary HBAR ETF (HBR) saw a net inflow of $29.9 million, a new record high since its listing. As of press time, the Canary HBAR ETF's total net asset value was $33.05 million, with an HBAR net asset ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of HBAR's total market capitalization) of 0.41%. The Canary Litecoin ETF (LTCC) saw no net inflows or outflows. As of press time, the Canary Litecoin ETF's total net asset value was $1.34 million, with an LTC net asset ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of LTC's total market capitalization) of 0.02%.

data.title: A whale address withdrew 1.05 billion PUMP from Binance, bringing its total holdings to 2.38 billion PUMP.
data.description: Onchain Lens monitoring shows that a whale address withdrew 1.05 billion PUMPs from Binance 5 hours ago, worth $5.13 million. The wallet currently holds 2.38 billion PUMPs, worth $10.65 million.
